page.title: 09Mitcham Common Factories 1
page.content: Before anything was built there, there was just common land. In 1782 the workhouse was built to house the poor and tramps. The path across the Common from the Blue House bridge is known as the Workhouse path. It was used as a Workhouse until 1838. The red brick building had a clock. When the local Workhouse was no longer required the local authorities wanted the building destroyed and the land returned to normal common land. The Lord of the Manor raised an objection.He said that the land and building was his and he wanted it to be a factory. When the Workhouse was not being used it was sold and used as a Lucifer match factory. It was one of the first in the country. Later the building was taken over by a rubber factory, where they made water proof clothing for the soldiers for the Crimea War.
